poem:
**Amnesty in June**

In dappled light,
Morning's breath caught
between iron bars
and the edge of the world.
10,000 sighs 
exhale into an open sky,
each step, a crack 
in the pavement's gray,
hope, thin as mist,
rises,
a whisper of wings 
in the empty corridors
of a nation's soul.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sunak government freed more than 10,000 prisoners up to 70 days early Rishi Sunak’s government released more than 10,000 prisoners up to 70 days early, figures reveal, as the new justice secretary prepares to announce further emergency measures to ease another overcrowding crisis in jails. Ministry of Justice figures show that 10,083 prisoners were allowed to walk free under the end of custody supervised licence (ECSL) scheme between October 2023 and June 2024 in England". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
